result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Pierce was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court orders the $500.00 cash bond be applied to the court costs.

1.  Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
2.  AODA (if the agent deems that the AODA that is to be done on the OWI-3rd will be ok - court leaves it up to the agent)
3.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
3:58 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Amaro Lopez.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Lopez, is not hired to represent the defendant on the new case.  Atty Lopez recites agreement, defendant will plea to count 1 on 2014CF26, count 2 on 2014CM21, count 1 on 2014CT25, all other charges are to be dismissed and read-in.  DA concurs.  Defendant concurs.  

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 on 2014CF26, count 2 on 2014CM21 and count 1 on 2014CT25.  Court orders the PAC charge be dismissed and orders all other charges be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing argument by DA.  Sentencing argument by Atty Lopez.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2014CF26 (Count 1) & 2014CM21 (Count 2):

Sentence Withheld and places the defendant on probation for 18 months, concurrent to each other.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-AODA (if the agent deems that the AODA that is to be done on the OWI-3rd will be ok - court leaves it up to the agent)
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.


2014CT25 (Count 1)

-50 days county jail with huber, to commence immediately.
-$650.00 Fine and costs totalling $1757.00
-D.L. revocation for 27 months
-IID for 27 months
-AODA

Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Court orders the bond of $500.00 on 2014CF26 be applied to the court costs on each case and one week of sentence credit (7 days) is to be applied to 2014CF26.

Court adjourned at 4:21 p.m.

Note:  After court - Court has no objection to the defendant serving the sentence in Fond du lac County.

To Suppress Evidence
from Atty Chadwock Kaehne requesting to appear via telephone for the Status Hearing scheduled on 08/19/2014. (VIA FAX ONLY)

11:08 a.m.  Defendant present in custody and with Atty Barbara Privat on 2014CF42 & 2014CF52 and Atty Chadwick Kaehne via telephone on 2014CT25, 2014CM21 & 2014CF26.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Kaehne will be scheduling a suppression motion and is to schedule in approx 30 days with the Judicial Assistant.  Atty Privat recites plea agreement, defendant will plea to count 1 & 4 on 2014CF52 and counts 2 on 2014CF42 and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in.  DA concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Atty Privat questions the court in regards to 83 days of sentence credit.  Statement by the Court, if sentences are concurrent, sentence credit would apply to both cases.  Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to count 1 &4 on 2014CF52 as charged and count 2 on 2014CF42 as charged.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 4 on 2014CF52 & count 2 on 2014CF42.  Court orders the balance of the counts be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  

COUNT 1 - Sentence Withheld and places the defendant on probation for 18 months.

CONDITIONS:
-  Defendant is to undergo, participate in and successfully complete alcohol and drug abuse assessment and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.
-  Defendant is to undergo, participate in and successfully complete a Domestic Abuse Assessment and comply with any follow-up counseling as recommended.
-  No Contact with the victim.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.
-  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
-  Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-  Court costs

Court grants the defendant 83 days of sentence credit if probation becomes revoked.

Count 2 & 4 (EACH) Court sentences the defendant to 83 days county jail on each count, concurrent to each other.  Court grants the defendant sentence credit of 83 days on each county for a Time Served sentence.  Court costs.

Court adjourned at 11:25  a.m..
